Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has enough water with some features indicating health, such as a few upright and green leaves.
The student can attempt to depict a plant without water by showing droopy or smaller leaves, but the distinction may not be clear.
The student may include a sun in their drawing, suggesting an awareness that light is also necessary for plants.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to clearly illustrate the difference between a well-watered and under-watered plant, leading to confusing visuals *(e.g., both plants may still look somewhat similar)*.
The student might not effectively draw side-by-side comparisons that convey the concept clearly *(student may not grasp the comparative element or forget to draw the second scenario)*.

The student may omit details such as changes in leaf texture or overall plant posture that distinguish a healthy plant from an unhealthy one *(student shows general shapes without specific indicators)*.
